intro: Endiandra teschneriana, commonly known as the Teschner's endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland to mid-elevation forests, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
